Every nonzero natural number has a unique prime factorization

name: Nat.factorization_inj
docString: Every nonzero natural number has a unique prime factorization

A prime number is odd if and only if it is not 2. (In other words, a prime number gives a remainder of 1 when divided by 2 if and only if it is not 2.)

name: Nat.Prime.mod_two_eq_one_iff_ne_two
docString: A prime number is odd if and only if it is not 2. (In other words, a prime number gives a remainder of 1 when divided by 2 if and only if it is not 2.)

This theorem states that a natural number is odd if and only if its remainder when divided by 4 is either 1 or 3. In other words, it characterizes odd numbers in terms of their residues modulo 4.

name: Nat.odd_mod_four_iff
docString: This theorem states that a natural number is odd if and only if its remainder when divided by 4 is either 1 or 3. In other words, it characterizes odd numbers in terms of their residues modulo 4.

A natural number is odd iff it has residue `1` or `3` mod `4`

name: Nat.odd_mod_four_iff
docString: A natural number is odd iff it has residue `1` or `3` mod `4`

A natural number is odd if and only if it is not even, or equivalently, a natural number is odd if and only if it can be expressed as 2 times an integer plus one, while an even number can be expressed as the sum of two integers.

name: Nat.odd_iff_not_even
docString: A natural number is odd if and only if it is not even, or equivalently, a natural number is odd if and only if it can be expressed as 2 times an integer plus one, while an even number can be expressed as the sum of two integers.

This theorem states that for any natural number `p` which is prime, `p` gives a remainder of 1 when divided by 2 if and only if `p` is not equal to 2. In other words, a prime number `p` is odd (since it gives a remainder of 1 when divided by 2) if and only if it is not the number 2 (which is the only even prime number).

name: Nat.Prime.mod_two_eq_one_iff_ne_two
docString: This theorem states that for any natural number `p` which is prime, `p` gives a remainder of 1 when divided by 2 if and only if `p` is not equal to 2. In other words, a prime number `p` is odd (since it gives a remainder of 1 when divided by 2) if and only if it is not the number 2 (which is the only even prime number).

name: Nat.Primes
docString: The type of prime numbers

The only numbers with empty prime factorization are `0` and `1`

name: Nat.factorization_eq_zero_iff'
docString: The only numbers with empty prime factorization are `0` and `1`

`2` is not a factor of an odd natural number.

type: ∀ {m n : ℕ}, Odd n → m ∣ n → m ≠ 2
name: Odd.ne_two_of_dvd_nat
docString: `2` is not a factor of an odd natural number.

The prime factors of a natural number as a finset.

name: Nat.primeFactors
docString: The prime factors of a natural number as a finset.

To prove Fermat's Last Theorem, it suffices to prove it for odd prime exponents.

type: (∀ (p : ℕ), Nat.Prime p → Odd p → FermatLastTheoremFor p) → FermatLastTheorem
name: FermatLastTheorem.of_odd_primes
docString: To prove Fermat's Last Theorem, it suffices to prove it for odd prime exponents.

**Lifting the exponent lemma** for odd primes.

type:
∀ {p : ℕ},
  Nat.Prime p →
    Odd p →
      ∀ {x y : ℤ},
        ↑p ∣ x - y →
          ¬↑p ∣ x → ∀ (n : ℕ), multiplicity (↑p) (x ^ n - y ^ n) = multiplicity (↑p) (x - y) + multiplicity p n
name: multiplicity.Int.pow_sub_pow
docString: **Lifting the exponent lemma** for odd primes.

A prime `p` satisfies `p % 2 = 1` if and only if `p ≠ 2`.

name: Nat.Prime.mod_two_eq_one_iff_ne_two
docString: A prime `p` satisfies `p % 2 = 1` if and only if `p ≠ 2`.

The only divisors of prime powers are prime powers.

type:
∀ {α : Type u_1} [inst : CancelCommMonoidWithZero α] [dec_irr : (p : Associates α) → Decidable (Irreducible p)]
  [inst_1 : UniqueFactorizationMonoid α] [dec : DecidableEq α] [dec' : DecidableEq (Associates α)] {a p : Associates α},
  Irreducible p →
    ∀ [inst_2 : (n : ℕ) → Decidable (a ∣ p ^ n)] {n : ℕ} (h : a ∣ p ^ n),
      a = p ^ Nat.find (_ : ∃ n, (fun n => a ∣ p ^ n) n)
name: Associates.eq_pow_find_of_dvd_irreducible_pow
docString: The only divisors of prime powers are prime powers.

The only prime factor of prime `p` is `p` itself.

type: ∀ {p q : ℕ}, Nat.Prime p → (Nat.factorization p) q ≠ 0 → p = q
name: Nat.Prime.eq_of_factorization_pos
docString: The only prime factor of prime `p` is `p` itself.

The only prime factor of prime `p` is `p` itself, with multiplicity `1`

type: ∀ {p : ℕ}, Nat.Prime p → Nat.factorization p = fun₀ | p => 1
name: Nat.Prime.factorization
docString: The only prime factor of prime `p` is `p` itself, with multiplicity `1`

The finset of those partitions in which every part is odd.

name: Nat.Partition.odds
docString: The finset of those partitions in which every part is odd.

A prime natural number is prime in `ℤ[i]` if and only if it is `3` mod `4`

name: GaussianInt.prime_iff_mod_four_eq_three_of_nat_prime
docString: A prime natural number is prime in `ℤ[i]` if and only if it is `3` mod `4`

In a finite field of odd characteristic, not every element is a square.

type: ∀ {F : Type u_3} [inst : Field F] [inst_1 : Finite F], ringChar F ≠ 2 → ∃ a, ¬IsSquare a
name: FiniteField.exists_nonsquare
docString: In a finite field of odd characteristic, not every element is a square.

The prime factors of n, regarded as a multiset

name: PNat.factorMultiset
docString: The prime factors of n, regarded as a multiset

The multiset consisting of a single prime

name: PrimeMultiset.ofPrime
docString: The multiset consisting of a single prime

`2` is a square modulo an odd prime `p` iff `p` is congruent to `1` or `7` mod `8`.

type: ∀ {p : ℕ} [inst : Fact (Nat.Prime p)], p ≠ 2 → (IsSquare 2 ↔ p % 8 = 1 ∨ p % 8 = 7)
name: ZMod.exists_sq_eq_two_iff
docString: `2` is a square modulo an odd prime `p` iff `p` is congruent to `1` or `7` mod `8`.

`-2` is a square modulo an odd prime `p` iff `p` is congruent to `1` or `3` mod `8`.

type: ∀ {p : ℕ} [inst : Fact (Nat.Prime p)], p ≠ 2 → (IsSquare (-2) ↔ p % 8 = 1 ∨ p % 8 = 3)
name: ZMod.exists_sq_eq_neg_two_iff
docString: `-2` is a square modulo an odd prime `p` iff `p` is congruent to `1` or `3` mod `8`.

The only prime divisor of positive prime power `p^k` is `p` itself

type: ∀ {k p : ℕ}, k ≠ 0 → Nat.Prime p → (p ^ k).primeFactors = {p}
name: Nat.primeFactors_prime_pow
docString: The only prime divisor of positive prime power `p^k` is `p` itself
